page.title: 01TOAB
page.content: This area to Toab lies just south of tankerness on the east mainland of orkney. The southwest part is a gently sloping ridge about 60 metres high sloping northeast toward Deer Sound. The ridge itself is moorland with several peat bogs. Large areas however axe being drained. The lower lying land is intensively farmed grassland for cattle and sheep. Running northwest-southeast is the kirkwall to Deerness road. The area is sparsely populated most of the farms and small holding are near to this road. In the northwest is kirkwall airport. In the south east is the Quoyburray Inn this is both a restaurant and pub and a faboured meeting place for locals, nearby is the St Andrews community Centre. this is used for dances, wedding etc. It also has a playing field for games.
